titles.title: Urging the President to raise, at the highest levels of the Government of the People's Republic of China, the issue of Chinese population transfer into Tibet in an effort to bring about an immediate end to that government's policy on this issue.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights.

committee.name: House Committee on Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations, and Human Rights

bill.summary: 5/27/1993--Introduced. Urges the President to raise, at the highest levels of the Government of the People's Republic of China, the issue of Chinese population transfer into Tibet in an effort to bring about an immediate end to that government's policy on this issue.
